title: More efficient disk sorting logic needed when handling border values for row count
OB: When sorting data on disk, if the number of rows is 40000 and the program is set to process less than 40000 rows, the following operations are performed by DtE: 1. Save the file as a temporary file.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk. 2. Set the program to process less than 40000 rows. 3. Observe the following operations performed by DtE:    a. Save the file as a temporary file.    b. Load the file into memory.    c. Sort the data in memory.    d. Save the file as a temporary file.
